author: barnabemonnot
content: hi! quick question that is more dev-related: will we have a way to monitor how many incoming transactions are native 1559 vs "legacy" transactions converted to the 1559 format? it'd be useful to have this statistic to measure the progress of dapps and wallets implementing 1559

author: abdel.stark
content: They wont be converted, their encoded representation will remain the same. They will only be interpreted using 1559 rules. So it will simple to distinguish them. If they have a gas price field set then it is a legacy transaction

author: abdel.stark
content: However in clients we can definitely implement metrics to measure this evolution.

author: timbeiko
content: So, how should block explorers display them, in your opinion?

author: timbeiko
content: Should they be show as legacy or regular txns?

author: abdel.stark
content: There should be a distinction in my opinion

author: abdel.stark
content: Maybe you add details next to the effective gas price

author: abdel.stark
content: and keep a single line. gas price is always the effective gas price, regardless of the transaction type, and you have additional info with details either directly or if you click on see more
